title: How to watch Premier League, Bundesliga, La Liga, Serie A, Ligue 1
text:
How to watch Premier League, Bundesliga, La Liga, Serie A, Ligue 1 Resize Text By Steven Goff October 15 at 4:15 PM Follow @soccerinsider Real Madrid’s Cristiano Ronaldo, center, returns to La Liga competition Saturday against Levante at the Bernabeu. (Javier Soriano/AFP-Getty Images) All times are Eastern FRIDAY 
2:30 p.m.: Monaco vs. Lyon beIN Sports Espanol, beIN Sports Connect (tape at 8 on beIN Sports) 
2:30 p.m.: Mainz vs. Borussia Dortmund Fox Sports 1, Fox Deportes, Fox Sports Go, foxsoccer2go.com SATURDAY 
7:45 a.m.: Tottenham Hotspur vs. Liverpool NBCSN, NBC Universo, NBC Sports Live Extra, nbcsports.com/liveextra 
9:30 a.m.: Wolfsburg vs. Hoffenheim foxsoccer2go.com 
9:30 a.m.: Augsburg vs. Darmstadt foxsoccer2go.com 
9:30 a.m.: Hamburg vs. Bayer Leverkusen Fox Deportes, foxsoccer2go.com

Steven Goff is The Post’s soccer writer. His beats include D.C. United, MLS and the international game, as well as local college basketball. sports Success! Check your inbox for details. You might also like: Please enter a valid email address Sign Up
